response: "I just can't keep up with everyone's expectations. It feels like I'm drowning in this never-ending quest for perfection."
"Why do I have to be flawless all the time? I'm exhausted from pretending to have it all together."
"I don't even recognize myself anymore. I'm losing touch with reality, trying to fit into this unrealistic mold society has created."
"The pressure to be perfect is driving me insane. I can't escape the constant judgment and criticism from others."
"I feel like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of comparison. It's suffocating, and I don't know how to break free."
"I'm constantly questioning my worth and value. It's as if society has convinced me that I'll never be good enough."
"I'm scared to show my true self because I fear rejection. The pressure to conform is overwhelming."
"I'm losing sight of what truly matters in life. All I can focus on is meeting society's unattainable standards."
"I'm trying to please everyone, but it's tearing me apart. I need to remember that my own happiness should come first."
"It's time to step back and reassess my priorities. I can't continue living like this; it's driving me crazy."
